defs.docs:
# Tera
 Tera is a template engine based on [Jinja2](http://jinja.pocoo.org/)
 and the [Django template language](https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.9/topics/templates/).

attributes.value: ! Tera is a template engine based on [Jinja2](http://jinja.pocoo.org/)
! See the [site](https://tera.netlify.com) for features and to get started.

             "Use `insert` instead to keep consistency with std collections")

defs.docs: Converts the `val` parameter to `Value` and insert it into the context

/ // user is an instance of a struct implementing `Serialize`

defs.name: extend
defs.docs:
Appends the data of the `source` parameter to `self`, overwriting existing keys.
 The source context will be dropped.

attributes.value: / Appends the data of the `source` parameter to `self`, overwriting existing keys.
/ The source context will be dropped.

defs.name: Template
defs.value: Template { name, path, ast, from_extend, macros, imported_macro_files, parent, blocks, parents, blocks_definitions }
defs.docs:
This is the parsed equivalent of a template file.
 It also does some pre-processing to ensure it does as less as possible at runtime
 Not mean to be used directly.

attributes.value: / This is the parsed equivalent of a template file.
/ It also does some pre-processing to ensure it does as less as possible at runtime
/ Not mean to be used directly.

defs.name: name
defs.docs: Name of the template, usually very similar to the path

attributes.value: / Name of the template, usually very similar to the path

defs.name: path
defs.docs:
Original path of the file. A template doesn't necessarily have
 a file associated with it though so it's optional.

attributes.value: / Original path of the file. A template doesn't necessarily have
/ a file associated with it though so it's optional.

defs.name: ast
defs.docs: Parsed AST, after whitespace removal

defs.name: from_extend
defs.docs:
Whether this template came from a call to `Tera::extend`, so we do
 not remove it when we are doing a template reload

attributes.value: / Whether this template came from a call to `Tera::extend`, so we do
/ not remove it when we are doing a template reload

defs.name: macros
defs.docs: Macros defined in that file: name -> definition ast

attributes.value: / Macros defined in that file: name -> definition ast

defs.name: imported_macro_files
defs.docs: (filename, namespace) for the macros imported in that file

attributes.value: / (filename, namespace) for the macros imported in that file

defs.name: parent
defs.docs: Only used during initial parsing. Rendering will use `self.parents`

attributes.value: / Only used during initial parsing. Rendering will use `self.parents`

defs.name: blocks
defs.docs: Only used during initial parsing. Rendering will use `self.blocks_definitions`

attributes.value: / Only used during initial parsing. Rendering will use `self.blocks_definitions`

defs.name: parents
defs.docs: The full list of parent templates

attributes.value: / The full list of parent templates

defs.name: blocks_definitions
defs.docs:
The definition of all the blocks for the current template and the definition of those blocks
 in parent templates if there are some.
 Needed for super() to work without having to find them each time.
 The type corresponds to the following `block_name -> [(template name, definition)]`
 The order of the Vec is from the first in hierarchy to the current template and the template
 name is needed in order to load its macros if necessary.

attributes.value: / The definition of all the blocks for the current template and the definition of those blocks
/ in parent templates if there are some.
/ Needed for super() to work without having to find them each time.
/ The type corresponds to the following `block_name -> [(template name, definition)]`
/ The order of the Vec is from the first in hierarchy to the current template and the template
/ name is needed in order to load its macros if necessary.

defs.name: new
defs.docs: Parse the template string given

defs.name: Tera
defs.value: Tera { templates, filters, testers, global_functions, autoescape_suffixes }
defs.docs: The main point of interaction in this library.

attributes.value: / The main point of interaction in this library.

defs.name: global_functions
defs.value: std::collections::HashMap<std::string::String, std::boxed::Box<(dyn std::ops::Fn(std::collections::HashMap<std::string::String, serde_json::Value>) -> std::result::Result<serde_json::Value, errors::Error> + std::marker::Send + std::marker::Sync + 'static)>>

defs.name: new
defs.docs: Create a new instance of Tera, containing all the parsed templates found in the `dir` glob

attributes.value: / Create a new instance of Tera, containing all the parsed templates found in the `dir` glob
/ The example below is what the [compile_templates](macro.compile_templates.html) macros expands to.

defs.name: parse
defs.docs:
Create a new instance of Tera, containing all the parsed templates found in the `dir` glob
 The difference with `Tera::new` is that it won't build the inheritance chains automatically
 so you are free to modify the templates if you need to.
 You will NOT get a working Tera instance using `Tera::parse`, you will need to call
 `tera.build_inheritance_chains()` to make it usable

attributes.value: / Create a new instance of Tera, containing all the parsed templates found in the `dir` glob
/ The difference with `Tera::new` is that it won't build the inheritance chains automatically
/ so you are free to modify the templates if you need to.
/ You will NOT get a working Tera instance using `Tera::parse`, you will need to call

defs.name: build_inheritance_chains
defs.docs:
We need to know the hierarchy of templates to be able to render multiple extends level
 This happens at compile-time to avoid checking it every time we want to render a template
 This also checks for soundness issues in the inheritance chains, such as missing template or
 circular extends.
 It also builds the block inheritance chain and detects when super() is called in a place
 where it can't possibly work

attributes.value: / We need to know the hierarchy of templates to be able to render multiple extends level
/ This happens at compile-time to avoid checking it every time we want to render a template
/ This also checks for soundness issues in the inheritance chains, such as missing template or
/ It also builds the block inheritance chain and detects when super() is called in a place
/ You generally don't need to call that yourself, unless you used `Tera::parse`

defs.name: check_macro_files
defs.docs:
We keep track of macro files loaded in each Template so we can know whether one or them
 is missing and error accordingly before the user tries to render a template.

attributes.value: / We keep track of macro files loaded in each Template so we can know whether one or them
/ is missing and error accordingly before the user tries to render a template.
/ As with `self::build_inheritance_chains`, you don't usually need to call that yourself.

defs.name: render
defs.docs: Renders a Tera template given an object that implements `Serialize`.

attributes.value: / Renders a Tera template given an object that implements `Serialize`.
/ To render a template with an empty context, simply pass a new `Context` object
/ If `data` is serializing to an object, an error will be returned.
/ // Rendering a template with a normal context
/ // Rendering a template with a struct that impl `Serialize`
/ // Rendering a template with an empty context

defs.name: one_off
defs.docs:
Renders a one off template (for example a template coming from a user input) given a `Context`
 or an object that implements `Serialize`.

attributes.value: / Renders a one off template (for example a template coming from a user input) given a `Context`
/ This creates a separate instance of Tera with no possibilities of adding custom filters
/ or testers, parses the template and render it immediately.
/ Any errors will mention the `one_off` template: this is the name given to the template by
/ // Or with a struct that impl Serialize

defs.name: add_raw_template
defs.docs: Add a single template to the Tera instance

attributes.value: / Add a single template to the Tera instance
/ This will error if the inheritance chain can't be built, such as adding a child
/ If you want to add several templates, use [Tera::add_templates](struct.Tera.html#method.add_templates)

defs.name: add_raw_templates
defs.docs: Add all the templates given to the Tera instance

attributes.value: / Add all the templates given to the Tera instance
/ This will error if the inheritance chain can't be built, such as adding a child

defs.name: add_template_file
defs.docs:
Add a single template from a path to the Tera instance. The default name for the template is
 the path given, but this can be renamed with the `name` parameter

attributes.value: / Add a single template from a path to the Tera instance. The default name for the template is
/ the path given, but this can be renamed with the `name` parameter
/ This will error if the inheritance chain can't be built, such as adding a child
/ If you want to add several file, use [Tera::add_template_files](struct.Tera.html#method.add_template_files)

defs.name: add_template_files
defs.docs:
Add several templates from paths to the Tera instance. The default name for the template is
 the path given, but this can be renamed with the second parameter of the tuple

attributes.value: / Add several templates from paths to the Tera instance. The default name for the template is
/ the path given, but this can be renamed with the second parameter of the tuple
/ This will error if the inheritance chain can't be built, such as adding a child
/     (path1, None), // this template will have the value of path1 as name
/     (path2, Some("hey")), // this template will have `hey` as name

defs.name: register_filter
defs.docs: Register a filter with Tera.

attributes.value: / If a filter with that name already exists, it will be overwritten

defs.name: register_tester
defs.docs: Register a tester with Tera.

attributes.value: / If a tester with that name already exists, it will be overwritten

defs.name: register_global_function
defs.docs: Register a global function with Tera.

attributes.value: / Register a global function with Tera.
/ If a global function with that name already exists, it will be overwritten

defs.name: register_function
defs.docs: Register a function with Tera.

attributes.value: / If a function with that name already exists, it will be overwritten

defs.name: autoescape_on
defs.docs:
Select which suffix(es) to automatically do HTML escaping on,
`[".html", ".htm", ".xml"]` by default.

attributes.value: / Select which suffix(es) to automatically do HTML escaping on,
/ Only call this function if you wish to change the defaults.

defs.name: set_escape_fn
defs.docs: Set user-defined function which applied to a rendered content.

attributes.value: / Set user-defined function which applied to a rendered content.

defs.name: reset_escape_fn
defs.docs: Reset escape function to default `tera::escape_html`.

defs.name: full_reload
defs.docs:
Re-parse all templates found in the glob given to Tera
 Use this when you are watching a directory and want to reload everything,
 for example when a file is added.

attributes.value: / Re-parse all templates found in the glob given to Tera
/ Use this when you are watching a directory and want to reload everything,
/ for example when a file is added.
/ If you are adding templates without using a glob, we can't know when a template
/ is deleted, which would result in an error if we are trying to reload that file

defs.name: extend
defs.docs:
Use that method when you want to add a given Tera instance templates/filters/testers
 to your own. If a template/filter/tester with the same name already exists in your instance,
 it will not be overwritten.

attributes.value: / Use that method when you want to add a given Tera instance templates/filters/testers
/ to your own. If a template/filter/tester with the same name already exists in your instance,
/ // add all the templates from FRAMEWORK_TERA
/ // except the ones that have an identical name to the ones in `my_tera`

defs.name: escape_html
defs.docs: Escape HTML following [OWASP](https://www.owasp.org/index.php/XSS_(Cross_Site_Scripting)_Prevention_Cheat_Sheet)

attributes.value: / Escape the following characters with HTML entity encoding to prevent switching
/ into any execution context, such as script, style, or event handlers. Using
/ hex entities is recommended in the spec. In addition to the 5 characters
/ significant in XML (&, <, >, ", '), the forward slash is included as it helps
/ / --> /     forward slash is included as it helps end an HTML entity
